title: Andromeda Galaxy
content: The nearest large spiral galaxy to the Milky Way, also designated M31. It's expected to collide with the Milky Way in about 4.5 billion years.

title: Spitzer Space Telescope
content: A NASA infrared space telescope launched in 2003 that studied distant galaxies, stars, and planetary systems before retiring in 2020.

title: Vera C. Rubin Observatory
content: A next-generation observatory in Chile designed to conduct a 10-year Legacy Survey of Space and Time (LSST), capturing deep images of the southern sky.
